website_summaries.verdict: Very affordable, it's a sound choice if the unique design appeals to you.
pros: Micro-channel design prevents gas buildup in baby's tummy
Angled design promotes proper feeding position
cons: After frequent use, some of our testers notated leakage

customer_reviews.title: Made from Polypropylene!
customer_reviews.text: What I like most is that they are made from polypropylene (#5 - safest plastic for food) and have no polycarbonates (#7 - plastics that originally contained BPA but now are often made with BPS & BPF). It would be great if they advertised this (or at least shared this somewhere). I had to call Playtex to learn this as I couldn't find the plastic type listed anywhere. They answered the phone & my question immediately. Call to confirm - 1-888-310-4290. Also, both of my children have love these bottles!
customer_reviews.author: E.LaBarre

customer_reviews.title: I swear by these bottles
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are absolutely amazing. Don't get me wrong they have a couple of extra parts but you'll definitely notice a benefit to your baby if they have any gas issues. I went from breastfeeding to a bottle because my little guy picked up RSV. So finding the right nipple was really hard and I never had to worry about a gas problems until we start using bottles. I had a friend recommend leaves bottles to me and they were a complete Game Changer for my little man. Would definitely buy these again in a heartbeat and always recommend them to other mommies.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Nelson

customer_reviews.title: The best!!
customer_reviews.text: these are great as playtex is designed with the vent system to help the baby from taking air and prevent colic. The angle of the bottle is designed to allow the baby to take in a limited amount of fluid at a time. How ever, when my son was old enough he started to trow the bottle and the bottom would come apart and spill the milk.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah GTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Vent Doesn't Work; Nipples Don't Last
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these because of the air venting system, which it turns out works about 20% of the time. The rest of the time, the air comes back through the nipple rather than the vents. My infants are always gassy and throw up after using these bottles (and for reference, they do not have these issues with the premade bottles from Similac, so I know it's these bottles). I've only been using these about 3 weeks and I've already had to throw away nipples because they collapse under the suction pressure. These are relatively easy to assemble and clean, but I'm going to try Dr. Browns instead.
customer_reviews.author: R20116M

customer_reviews.title: Not the greatest at limiting air
customer_reviews.text: I like the angle of the bottle. I don't like having to deal with so many pieces but to reduce colic I can deal. But the bottle doesn't vent strictly from the bottom like it describes. I still see bubbles coming from the nipple as baby eats. So while the idea is great, this doesn't totally eliminate venting from the nipple. I guess the only bottle that completely eliminate air would be the drop ins.
customer_reviews.author: AMC

customer_reviews.title: Leaking terrible!!!
customer_reviews.text: For moms that have a hard time producing milk, this bottle is NOT for you. I gave it a try because my baby liked the nipple however I noticed it was leaking every time so I read that some parents said the parts needed to be dry well before assembly so I did. However it kept leaking. My wife got so upset and mad because it reached the point where she lost a lot of milk because of the bottles so she had to supplement with formula. I am returning the bottles and I do not recommend this product at all.
customer_reviews.author: Mike May

customer_reviews.title: Great for Reflux
customer_reviews.text: We had the Avent anti-colic bottles for my first and started using them for my second. However, he had reflux and we were having trouble getting him to keep food down. These bottles helped a lot. They didn't solve the problem but we were able to avoid putting him on an antacid and he started gaining weight. He is 5 months now and seems to have outgrown the reflux but I still love these bottles. The bend makes holding it so much more comfortable for me. Cleaning is slightly more annoying because of the extra pieces but overall it is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: KaScho2015

customer_reviews.title: A must have👍
customer_reviews.text: Ever since I started using this product, I never had problems with my now 6m baby having stomachaches and/or uncomfortableness..and because of this, I'm back n nursing him again with him not having a problem to latch on me. Lovelovelove it😊❤❤
customer_reviews.author: Bella B. M.

customer_reviews.title: These bottles leak very badly! I lined the arrows ...
customer_reviews.text: These bottles leak very badly! I lined the arrows up perfectly and tried unscrewing and repositioning the pieces several times but it still leaked!
customer_reviews.author: Melanie Cottrill

customer_reviews.title: Love the design and it really works - just leaky.
customer_reviews.text: I really enjoy these bottles; candidly I'm not even sure why we still have "straight" bottles because this design is far superior. However, the vent on the bottom that helps prevent the colic unfortunately does result in some leaks. I assume milk gets in between the flange and the bottle while I shake it. I could just be shaking it too hard, I am pretty tense these days. I did just have a baby in a pandemic after all.
customer_reviews.author: Triple X

customer_reviews.title: Old Faithful
customer_reviews.text: After trying so many of the newer updated bottles out there we are back to what I used for my own child. My grandson had difficulty transitioning from the breast & when I ordered these just so they could try them they loved them. The best part is they were the least expensive of all the bottles they tried. After all these years Playtex still delivers quality merchandise. I should have just bought them sooner.
customer_reviews.author: NxtraSpoiledBrat

customer_reviews.title: Great for colicky baby! Great for any baby!
customer_reviews.text: A great bottle for anyone to use for a new baby. My baby happens to be a little colic and these bottles work better than some of the even more expensive ones. I went through many different bottles before I decided to use these. They are easy to clean but I would recommend not putting them in the dishwasher because it will decrease the measurements on the side of the bottles. But if you hand wash them oh, you should not have a problem I have never had a problem and that's how I clean them. Great bottle all around. Also very affordable.
customer_reviews.author: Summer

customer_reviews.title: Just say no moms and dads
customer_reviews.text: Terrible. Leaked everywhere even after thorough reading to make sure it wasn’t user error. Not only that it took my son 30minutes to eat less than an oz when usually he’s already eaten two in that time (the nipple was the right size made sure to give the product a fair chance). Bought it for the design and anticolic/reflux properties but I guess you get what you paid for. Would have returned but I would want these recirculating so out they went. Will stick to dr. Browns.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Hanchey

customer_reviews.title: Well engineered product
customer_reviews.text: After spend quite some time researching baby bottles I decided to give these a try and I don’t regret that decision. My baby has been using these from day one, she’s now three months old and have never suffered from colic. My cousin had a baby a month before me, used another brand of baby bottles and baby really suffered with colic. I recommended they switch to these after that was done baby’s colic dramatically reduced. All the components of this bottle comes apart easily for proper cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: ALTEREDSTATE16

customer_reviews.title: Comes with slow flow nipples
customer_reviews.text: Comes with slow flow nipples! I bought these for my first child and they worked well so I wanted to get new ones for my second child 3 years later. The questions said they came with medium nipples, and I have a newborn, so I bought packs of slow flow nipples. They came with slow flow nipples. Annoying that I have to deal with a return because the information wasn't correct.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Was very hard for my baby to suck out of. I couldn't even suck much liquid out of these.
customer_reviews.text: I like the design and I personally had no leaking issues, but I never used mine in a bottle warmer either which I think messes with the seal. My issue was my newborn would suck like crazy for an hr. And barely drink a half oz. I decided to try a diff. Bottle i had on hand and it was much better. I filled a bottle and attempted to try to suck out of it myself and it was very difficult for me to get anything out.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.W.

customer_reviews.title: Best bottle used so far
customer_reviews.text: Easiest to use, very soft nipples, and overall good design. Does leak occasionally if not properly used. Tips to prevent leaking: Don't put the bottle in a warmer. After filling with warm milk, tip bottle over a sink and unscrew the bottom a bit to relive pressure. Then screw back on.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan hopper

customer_reviews.title: Helped with gas, but there are a few flaws
customer_reviews.text: It helped with my babys gas so I gave it 4 stars. There are a few things I didnt like though. It takes longer for the bottle to heat up in the bottle warmer because of the thick plastic bottom. And once I took it out of the warmer there is so much hot water that catches in the plastic piece that screws off. You have to tip it to the side to let the water drain off and wipe it down really good before you feed. I've burned myself a few times from the hot water, and its dropped on my son before too. But other than that it's a good bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: Target and Walmart will price match, these ones are discontinued though.
customer_reviews.text: Ok I will start with the good, Target and Walmart will price match you on the for the non discontinued version (they’re amazing, go buy them p.s- I went from Dr. Browns to these... WAY BETTER, WAY CHEAPER!) that cost almost $14. Just go get them, walk up to check out, and say I need a price match and show these to them. Do NOT say “these are the discontinued ones”. But, THESE ARE THE DISCONTINUED VERSION. DO NOT BUY THESE ONES! Just use this as a way to get 50% off the amazing ones at Target or Walmart!
customer_reviews.author: Rain Green

customer_reviews.title: highly recommended!
customer_reviews.text: First time using these bottles and love them. No leaks, easy to clean and baby gas is to a minimum. Was a gassy baby with other bottles but with these he burps no problem after feeding. The curve neck helps to get every last drop. Recommend these bottles very highly!
customer_reviews.author: C

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my babies
customer_reviews.text: I will never use any other bottle for my children! These are the best! I love the angled shape... helps with my little one who would never recline and eat; always had to sit up! The air vent bottoms never leaks unless the cover isn't tight enough. You cannot use these with a bottle warmer tho, which is my only disappointment, since the hot water will lift the valve inside and spill milk into your warmer. You have to use separate bottle or microwave. Regardless, I love these bottles!
customer_reviews.author: Schatzie

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend! 5 week old does great with these bottles.
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure if id like these. They seem so big for an infant. But we love them! I loved the standard size but they are now discontinued. My 5 week old does a great job with these! He was having trouble latching to the other nipples. Either by collapsing them from sucking so hard or having milk drip down his chin or gulping. No matter what level flow we used. Not to mention the air he would swallow. But these bottles are awesome! Minimal tummy gas & burping, No dripping, gulping or choking! Easy to clean & put back together. I highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: MamaMelD

customer_reviews.title: The nipples are a good size for his mouth
customer_reviews.text: After trying multiple bottles, my 2 month old son finally took these...for a while. Because I'm mostly breastfeeding, I wanted a slow flow nipple to avoid issues with baby preferring the bottle. These definitely have that. The nipples are a good size for his mouth, too. As long as we burp him after every 5 minutes or so of feeding, my son hasn't had trouble with spitting up, using these bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Sabira

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn't recommend this bottle to an exclusively breastfed baby.
customer_reviews.text: I cant give this product a completely negative review because my daughter will use these bottles if I give them to her but they just don't seem to be as easy or natural for her like the other brand I use. I breastfeed so when comparing this nipple to my breast I'm not impressed. To put it simply, I wouldn't recommend this bottle to an exclusively breastfed baby. I was highly recommend this bottle from family so it clearly works for some babies, my daughter is just not one of them.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan/Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: It’s ok
customer_reviews.text: Had a hard time finding this size in stores so hence I bought them online. Only reason I did not give it five stars is because one I’m not sure if it’s because of time but after some time they leak From the bottom. And in the inside under the blue rubber piece sometimes there is build up
customer_reviews.author: Veronica Locarno

customer_reviews.title: LEAKS when warmed. Don't buy especially if breastmilk only.
customer_reviews.text: My daughter solely gets breastmilk. We use these bottles when I am at work. More often than not when warming the bottles they are starting to leak badly and waste this liquid gold. This is very disappointing. To say the least 18 bottles are gong to waste due to the leaking problem. Would NOT recommend especially if baby is breastmilk fed only and you have to use a bottle warmer. By the way my bottle warmer is meant to warm breastmilk
customer_reviews.author: LuvOnlineShopping

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Amazing Bottle
customer_reviews.text: Who would have ever thought these cheap bottles would be so amazing! Each of my children have used different bottles. With my youngest this is the only type she liked all others seems to come out too fast!. These bottles have helped so much with her colic and Acid Reflex. We try Dr. Brown, MAM, you name it and these are the ones she loves! Love how easy they are to clean and sterilize.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin Dial

customer_reviews.title: Easy to clean and neutral look!
customer_reviews.text: I used these bottles for my 2nd son and he did so well being a small baby, I had to get them for my 3rd son too! Good long spout!
customer_reviews.author: Lagina H

customer_reviews.title: It leaks and it makes bubbles. Awful.
customer_reviews.text: It leaks. It leaks and leaks and leaks some more. Do not purchase this if planning on putting it in the fridge. The change in temperature from cold to room to cold will make this leak from the bottom. It's extremely annoying. Also, this generates a ton of air bubbles from the nipple. Extremely annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Testing Test

customer_reviews.title: Baby didn’t like
customer_reviews.text: We used Dr. Brown’s bottles and I was tired of washing all the pieces, so we tried this. My five week old didn’t do well with it. The nipple would collapse constantly. It was nice to hold, but didn’t work out. Will stick with what we had.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Thought for my cousin's baby shower as a gift
customer_reviews.text: These are very good bottles and I bought them for my cousin for her baby shower because she uses them all the time for all of her babies and these were the specific ones that she wanted to use for her new one I bought the bigger ones and the smaller ones.
customer_reviews.author: Arden Marsh

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles
customer_reviews.text: Best bottles for my twins. I tried Dr.brown, Avent& medal bottles . Both of my girls spit up and had stomach issues got these bottles and couldn't be happier. The girls don't have any stomach or spit up issues like they did in the beginning. I would highly recommend this . Easy to clean and great price.
customer_reviews.author: patricia pawloski

customer_reviews.title: We say YES!!!
customer_reviews.text: We love love love these bottles! They work great and barely have any bubbles from the vent!!! Which is perfect reducing colicky! Happy babies!!!! They lasted great till about months age then needed to go bigger to hold more ounces
customer_reviews.author: Nunez.Family.Farms

customer_reviews.title: Have deficiences
customer_reviews.text: Those are bottles, and they mostly work. I have two concerns with them: 1. [minor] When using asymmetric nipple, it's usually in strange position (goes sideways) and while it's possible to open the bottle and and rotate the nipple, i never do that, just have to rotate my hand. 2. [major] When heating the milk, i usually put the bottle in a cup with hot water. Due to pressure buildup, milk starts to leak into the cup, according to customer service we need to unscrew the top to prevent from a pressure buildup. So while the bottles work, i'm not using them since they require additional actions which i can easily forget to do and seems just redundant to me.
customer_reviews.author: R.G.

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: I looove these bottles! The nipple is slow, they’re easy to clean and with all the bottles that say “anti-colic” or “prevents air” most don’t actually do that, with the air pockets on the bottom you can actually hear it coming out. My #1 go to because it’s easier to clean then Dr. Browns! Only downside is it takes sooo long to feed from this bottle compared to others but that doesn’t bother me much, less spit up!
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne Fowler

customer_reviews.title: Good, but not as good as Dr. Brown's
customer_reviews.text: Love the bend, makes holding the bottle easier. I feel like the Dr. Brown's bottles are better for reducing air intake and colic though. I really wish that there was a bottle that combined both this bottle and the anti-colic system of the Dr Brown's bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Mondo

customer_reviews.title: Redesigned, Fast Flow Nipples = Ruined the Product
customer_reviews.text: The Ventaire bottles were redesigned and the nipple design change is terrible! My daughter refused to nurse from these bottles, because they come with fast flow nipples, which flooded her mouth with milk, choking and gagging her. Had I known that they do not come with slow flow nipples (like the tri-color Ventaires I already had), I never would have bought these. I like that shorter, fatter bottle shape, because they are easier to clean than the taller, thinner bottles. However, the nipple issue is a really big deal and watching my daughter struggle to feed is frustrating. I am very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Maria J. Fahlsing

customer_reviews.title: Bottles leak
customer_reviews.text: So far so good! I bought them because in the low milk production org web page suggest the natural latch nipples to be more similar to the breast and the flow also. When you use this bottles you can hear the air coming out from the bottom. I recommend! Update: I changed my mind, This bottles leak. I have not found a way to avoid it. It doesn't always ocurr, but after some much time spend pumping it frustrating to see it spilled. I do love the Nipple, which is the reason I bought them in first place. For that I am giving 3 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Mari

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I had my 3rd child and used these. With my previous two pregnancies and bottle years I used the play text liner kind of bottles but that was such an extra expense so this time I decided to give these a try and I do not regret the decision at all. It is just like those other bottles minus the expense of the liner so if you are a fan of those bottles then you'll definitely be a fan of these bottles. There are a few extra parts to clean since there is a valve in the bottle that's the only thing but other than that these are great bottles!
customer_reviews.author: VANESSA

customer_reviews.title: Great for reducing gas
customer_reviews.text: These work for preventing gas. We have tried 3 other leading brands and these work best for tummy ache. The nipples are good and baby latches even with a rear tongue tie. We buy new nipples every 3 months with constant use otherwise they cave in. Will continue to use.
customer_reviews.author: The Girl Geek

customer_reviews.title: These are awesome bottles!
customer_reviews.text: If you are thinking about buying these, do it! I love them. My baby has less gas, it’s easier to feed upright, and it takes much less effort for my newborn to eat. (Other bottles the nipples would collapse and she would get frustrated trying to eat) She is breast and bottle fed and has no problem going back and forth.
customer_reviews.author: lucille b

customer_reviews.title: Definatly wouldnt buy them again
customer_reviews.text: These bottles worked great the first few times that we used them other then the fast flow. The nipples started spraying milk every where we finally figured out a trick to get them to stop but they still dripped milk pretty rapidly. The milk slowly started to leak from the bottom which I thought was normal bc it was just a few drops. Then I noticed the milk pouring out of the bottom to the point the whole 5oz was on the floor within 30 seconds. I had to throw them away. The circle rubber piece was perfectly in place just wasn't working. I've had these bottles with my other children and never had these issues.
customer_reviews.author: alyssa

customer_reviews.title: hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: I bought two packages of these and they both had at least one bottle inside of them that leaked from the bottom. they are not easy to clean. I couldn’t even shake up formula in them without milk going everywhere so I gave up
customer_reviews.author: Brittany H

customer_reviews.title: FYI: MADE IN CHINA
customer_reviews.text: Although it states above that these are made in the USA, which why I bought them, they are in fact made in China. Just thought who were looking for made in the USA products would like to know.
customer_reviews.author: SapphireSkies

customer_reviews.title: Cheaper than anywhere else!
customer_reviews.text: We found these the cheapest on Amazon than we did anywhere else. I love that I could order them online and have them at my door in 2 days rather than hauling the 2 kids out and going to the store a half hour away. These are a very good bottle, we personally like the older ones that are smaller but these work just as well for getting the air out of the bottle. It advertises that they have the new blue vent but they do not have the blue vent in them, you need to purchase those additionally.
customer_reviews.author: CKHODAPP

customer_reviews.title: but she handles formula a whole lot better with these
customer_reviews.text: My child does not have colic, but she handles formula a whole lot better with these. I also love how they disassemble for complete cleaning. Also these are twice as big as those at Walmart at almost half the price on Amazon. I have checked out other bottles (some which aren't worth near what they were priced) and this is the only bottle that impressed me.
customer_reviews.author: Tony and Lira Diodato

customer_reviews.title: NOT HAPPY
customer_reviews.text: Used these before with another child and loved them. Yet tried them now and not happy. They do not make our little one want to drink. Babies are fickle and she just does not like these
customer_reviews.author: Krista&Bill

customer_reviews.title: Be careful
customer_reviews.text: I warm my bottles with hot water and it gets under the bottom portion of the bottle. I try to dry it , but when feeding be careful water doesn’t fall unto your little one. I have to put a burp cloth to catch the water that falls
customer_reviews.author: LucyFam

customer_reviews.title: these baby bottles are great. They do seem to minimize swallowing air
customer_reviews.text: I still think breast feeding is the most convenient, fuss free, and economical choise for feeding a baby, However as a grandmother who has taken care of her infant grandchildren for weeks and months at a time, these baby bottles are great. They do seem to minimize swallowing air. There are easy to clean in a dish washer and easy to hold and fill. There are not as many fussy pieces as other bottles. This bottles come with medium nipples, so you will need to buy slow nipple for a new board and faster nipples for a middle age
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for orphaned puppies!
customer_reviews.text: Got these for a liter of orphaned puppies. You can't feed puppies on their backs or standing up. And it's hard to hold normal bottles without them getting air in their tummies. Bought these and since they're bent and have the ventaire vent, no more gassy fussy pups! Loved them. These were great.
customer_reviews.author: Katelyn

customer_reviews.title: Long time user disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed. I used Ventaire bottles for my first and second baby and loved them. They seem to be much more cheaply made this time. Every one I have leaks slightly around the top. Just a drip or two but that quickly makes a mess. I'm going with MAM's version this time and I'll see if Playtex will give me a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Dove

customer_reviews.title: I like this type of bottle
customer_reviews.text: Cons: not easy to clean or assemble Always check if there is any leak, and if you warm up the bottle, some hot water does stay and drip out when tilt. Pros: makes feeding in the night a lot easier, it’s shape makes every drop goes to the belly
customer_reviews.author: L. J.

customer_reviews.title: Overall I like these bottles
customer_reviews.text: Overall I like these bottles. They’re easy to clean and my kid seems to like them. My issue is with the nipples. Some of them are firm and do a great job with no leaking. Others fee a lot thinner and cave in while my son sucks on them. It’s so infuriating when he started to wear half of his bottle. The nipples that do work are great though!
customer_reviews.author: MsV8r

customer_reviews.title: They Leak a Lot
customer_reviews.text: These do help with gas, but they leak constantly, especially as the bottles get older. The gaskets don't work as well and without warning the bottle will start leaking like a sieve. You have to hold the bottle up-side-down with your finger on the nipple, unscrew the bottom, and re-seal the gasket. Not fun when you have a screaming baby wanting its bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Alex K

customer_reviews.title: Favorite Bottle Period
customer_reviews.text: I recently purchased these for my bundle of joy who is due in a few weeks. I first used these bottles with my son and I loved them. The air flow is great and never gets gas in the babies tummy.
customer_reviews.author: Anya Ross

customer_reviews.title: Significantly Less Gas
customer_reviews.text: Glad I purchased these bottles. I’ve tried several bottles and these bottles work for my baby. These bottles are not hard to clean. You can remove the top and bottom to obtain a thorough cleaning.
customer_reviews.author: Tressy

customer_reviews.title: Only bottle my baby takes well!
customer_reviews.text: I tried 3 varieties of bottles with my little guy before I got these! I wasn't having very much success, even with the top rated and more expensive bottles. I read that other moms had experienced successful feeding with these so I gave them a try and love them! They are so easy to clean and truly do the job. My baby is 10months and still using these. He's evens till using the slow flow nipples. He took to these so well I would definitely recommend trying them!
customer_reviews.author: Krinda R

customer_reviews.title: Great minus 1 minor thing..
customer_reviews.text: Love these bottles!!! My only gripe would be deconstructing the bottle to thoroughly clean it out. Just a wee bit annoying when you have multiple bottles and is another step in cleaning when you’re trying to rush
customer_reviews.author: Kristy Scheidt

customer_reviews.title: Better than Doc. Brown's
customer_reviews.text: My favorite bottles. They are quick to clean and perform well with minimal extra air intake for the baby. One note is that you will find your performance is largely based on the different nipples (sold separetly) you choose. The default slow nipple is not very useful past 3-4 months. I don't find there is consistency in the other nipples you can purchase. One medium flow nipple does often not flow at the same rate as the next - by a wide enough margin that I find some unusable and some perfect. Still, the bottle does its job and I've been pleased with it after working with 3 different brands.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M.

customer_reviews.title: Good.
customer_reviews.text: Well you can't beat the price, these bottles definatley help lessen the air intake by baby. I have noticed over using them about 3 weeks the nipples get weird over time (bending/suctioning) in while baby sucks.
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Kennedy

customer_reviews.title: Love this bottle!
customer_reviews.text: Love this bottle, my toddler refused to take formula since 2 months old. After stopping breastfeeding for 2 weeks, she finally accepted formula from this bottle! I purchase a pair of angled nipples together, both the original and angled nipples works good. The bottle is easy to clean, and after reading the insert, I found the smart idea to snap the cap on the bottom when you feed the baby, then you won't looking around for the cap after feeding. And the price is also fair, $9.99 for a 3-pack. Definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: G.T.

customer_reviews.title: Great bottles
customer_reviews.text: Best bottles for infant !! My 5 month old loves it and I been using them since he was 2 month old. So convenient for formula and for babies to sip on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I recommend these.
customer_reviews.text: These are great. So convenient to hold and I love the slant so that the baby can easily drink from. It takes a little more to clean as you have to take it apart. But it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.author: Diana

customer_reviews.title: Sometimes too wide for lil ones to hold
customer_reviews.text: I really like this bottles my 9 year old use to drink them but my lil one does not like them and had a hard time holding them when she was littler
customer_reviews.author: nancy

customer_reviews.title: Makes transitioning from breast to bottle super easy!
customer_reviews.text: These are my favorite type of bottles for babies. My thirteen year old used them when he was a baby and was the only bottle he would take. Now that I’m a caregiver...I use them for the children who are strictly breastfed at home. It makes the transition from breast to bottle super easy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Rosa B.76

customer_reviews.title: Quality!
customer_reviews.text: My baby nephew is using these bottles. They are safe for babies, they aren't harmful in anyways. The material made are all certified and they won't cause any hazards. Fair warning. Wash them and keep them in a sanitized area. If you don't, it doesn't matter what quality you buy your baby bottles! Storing them is just as important as buying the right ones!
customer_reviews.author: Mingxin

customer_reviews.title: These leak. Stay away!
customer_reviews.text: Terrible! After only 4 mos of use these bottles leak everywhere... It's especially frustrating when it happens at night while baby is having her bottle while sleeping 😡
customer_reviews.author: Iliena Popow

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: I've switched both my sons to these once about 5 months old. They do good and don't cause gas. Pretty easy to clean, just watch the inner rims at top and bottom.
customer_reviews.author: meganp

customer_reviews.title: Great bottle
customer_reviews.text: We originally received these as a baby shower gift. When the baby was little we used the Drop ins 4 oz size. I liked the ease of those. Since the baby has switched to a larger size, I LOVE these. The angled base is great and the vents within work perfectly They are very easy to clean and I feel like they are actually "clean". I like that all the pieces come apart to ensure that you are cleaning every possible crevice. I will be sure to give these at the next baby shower I attend.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Playtex never fails
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always used playtex my mom used it on her kids and my kids will use with there’s they are always durable bottles less air so no gassy baby nipple allows just right amount of milk to come threw always recommend playtex
customer_reviews.author: bk29693

customer_reviews.title: Our baby had terrible gas/colic issues
customer_reviews.text: These are nothing special. Our baby had terrible gas/colic issues. He has a slight tongue tie, also, which causes a "clicking" when he eats, meaning he's getting extra air. The nipples of these don't seem to help the problem. There are other types of nipples you can use for these, but none seemed to be a shape he needed, long and narrow. The vent system does seem ok so if the nipple works for your baby they'd be fine. In the end we found Dr. Brown's to work the best. Wish I hadn't bought so many of these.
customer_reviews.author: mariabelle01

customer_reviews.title: Much better!
customer_reviews.text: My 6 wk old son is the gassiest lil thing EVER! I really wanted to like my nuks and tommy tippee bottles BUT when you'd mix the formula it'd have 1 to 2oz of freaking bubbles, at least! These still have a few.. LITERALLY a few compared to the others and my sons gas has had a major improvement and the price wasn't bad either. If you have a child suffering with gas, these with some gas relief or gripe water should definitely help.
customer_reviews.author: Loren H

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work for reflux
customer_reviews.text: I used these playtex bottles many times and never had an issue. Not sure but the bottles are not working. The reflux is still there and now I need to transition to another product.
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Hall

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality and tough to use :(
customer_reviews.text: Leaks so badly.. you have to be so cautious while filling the bottle since it has DOUBLE SIDE OPENING... not so easy to close especially the bottom opening... I lost my pumped milk trying to use this bottle :( also poor quality
customer_reviews.author: sumanth

customer_reviews.title: They don't vent
customer_reviews.text: I can't get these to vent and my daughter gets so mad that she can't get milk out. I'm glad I didn't pay much for them.
customer_reviews.author: foroneaudience

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: I liked these bottles up until a few days ago. I've had them for two months and they are now leaking at the bottom. I replaced the nipples because they kept getting clogged and I'm having the same problem with the brand new ones. I 've used these bottles with my other children and had no problems at all. I'm super disappointed because I've always loved playtex baby bottles.
customer_reviews.author: Dominique

customer_reviews.title: Leaking issue
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they were recommended to me. I loved them in the beginning but after a week or two they began to leak. When it first started happening I had hoped it was just due to washing the bottles recently but after letting them dry for several hours and trying again they still leaked so I knew it wasn’t from recently washing. If it weren’t for the leaking issue i would buy more but unfortunately I had to buy another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla Mason

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: I have used this brand of bottles for almost three years now. With my last baby, I actually bought another brand of bottles and was terribly disappointed. If I ever have any more kids in the future, these will be the bottles I buy. I breastfed also and these were not a problem.
customer_reviews.author: Karin

customer_reviews.title: THE BEST BOTTLES
customer_reviews.text: Out of all the different bottles we have tried, these were by far the best. You won't have an issue with leaks if you take the bottle apart to wash it every single time (Which you should be doing anyways). There is a small rubber seal when you unscrew the bottom piece, make sure that is put back in and you're good to go!
customer_reviews.author: Marisa

customer_reviews.title: AN A++++ PRODUCT!
customer_reviews.text: This baby bottle is the best in my opinion, my baby grandson does NOT spit up after feedings from this bottle. He burps a couple of times usually but never spits up! I'ts such a fantastic product! I would highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Mary Madrid

customer_reviews.title: These are our favorite bottles.
customer_reviews.text: These are our favorite bottles. They allow the bottle to breath so the baby does not need to stop drinking to let air in so the milk will go down. Imagine drinking a drink out of a plastic bottle and not letting air in, this is what other bottles we had did. This allow the milk/formula to keep flowing. We actually bought 20 of them with different flow tops so we have enough. I also really like that they come apart, I feel like it gets cleaned better that way.
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bottle
customer_reviews.text: This has been my favorite bottle for all of my 4 children. They have all done well with it, no spit-up issues with any of my kids. I am so glad they still make these!
customer_reviews.author: katie

customer_reviews.title: Excellent bottle
customer_reviews.text: I love these bottles, they really help minimize the amount of air my baby gets at the end of her bottle since it is tilted. These are also beneficial when you go from nursing to bottles because you hold the bottle in front of the baby instead of tilting their head back and giving it to them from above, its a little more work for them so they don't get too lazy about feeding. Breastfeeding is harder work for them than a bottle, so this helps. Make sure to thoroughly clean, can be a little tricky by the bend
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Does prevent colic and spit up!
customer_reviews.text: Great bottles, durable, easy to use and clean, however not in love with trying to use these at night. But overall great bottle!
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles for colic.
customer_reviews.text: Since my son was born he had a very severe case of colic. While I was pregnant I bought the tommee tippee bottles because alot of my friends recommended them. My son would gag while drinking his bottle. I did some research and the ventaire really caught my attention it was also half the price of most bottles. I love these bottles. It does have a few more pieces to wash than your regular bottles, but it's worth it. My son does not get full of gas and cry after every meal anymore.
customer_reviews.author: Jessie L.

customer_reviews.title: Good buy
customer_reviews.text: Gave as a gift and they were well liked but their baby wasnt latching all the way around well enough.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Still gets alot of air
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 3 stars because our daughter still manages to get alot of Air from it I know how to use it right as well
customer_reviews.author: Kat Michele Hanson

customer_reviews.title: I don't love it, what, you think I use a bottle?  I'm a grown man for crying out loud!
customer_reviews.text: But the nurse leading the breast feeding support group suggested this to try to keep baby from getting used to the fast flow and smaller shape of most bottle nipples, and it seems to do the trick as much as anything could. You get three with this box, so you don't have to keep washing your one bottle. Except that you do, because if you don't wash breast milk out right away the ants come. Oh god, the ants. Here we go again...
customer_reviews.author: German

customer_reviews.title: LIFESAVERS
customer_reviews.text: We went through about four days of our daughter screaming (2-3 weeks) her head off after any feeding. Despite burping, gas drops, changing feedings, etc. it was her awful bottles (avent). tried these in a desperate shopko shopping trip and haven't went back! They are so great at getting out the air so she doesn't inhale it. the nipple is truly a slow flow so she isn't throwing up like she was or getting drowned. Minimal mess while she eats even being a newborn :) so thankful for such a great product -- at least for our daughter. Thanks playtex !!
customer_reviews.author: Bob

customer_reviews.title: I bought Playtex Ventaire bottles before and they worked great! Nippples that came with each of these bottles ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought Playtex Ventaire bottles before and they worked great! Nippples that came with each of these bottles leaked terribly( put water in nipple and water just came out in a stream, used medium flow nipple), so had to buy new ones. Even had trouble with leaking when turning bottle over to feed baby with new nipples( nipple worked right when putting water in it like I did before). Works well for preventing gas for baby though.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie  K

customer_reviews.title: Near perfect
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Although just watch that some formula powder my be left alone the lip if you mix in bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: baby approved
customer_reviews.text: Excellent! My 1 month old loves these bottles. **update** Terrible bottles. They leak everywhere and are a pain. My son is now refusing these bottles and they leak ALL over him and everything else.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi H.

customer_reviews.title: No more gas or colic..these really work like magic.
customer_reviews.text: No more gas or spit up!!! Love these. I tried Tommee tippee and there was so much gas with those. These are like night and day. Jtgey make having a newborn in a bottle just that much easier without all of the fuss. If you are having a fussy baby trust me and try these. You will end up buying 3 more and never looking back. Also they are super easy to wash. Very happy baby and an even more happy mom! 👍
customer_reviews.author: Mrs. .bought that

customer_reviews.title: Works for us!
customer_reviews.text: Since having our son we have tried a few different types of bottles. Some of which are considered top of the line and pricey. These are by far the best we have come across. Sometimes it just comes down to trial and error to find out what works for you. I feel this is a more wallet friendly option.
customer_reviews.author: Montry Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Package come damaged
customer_reviews.text: Package arrived damaged. Come in regular plastic envelope. But what’s wondering that envelope was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Vitalie

customer_reviews.title: Loved
customer_reviews.text: Really helped my baby with his gas and acid reflex issues. Its the only bottle we can use, we tried lots of different brands before we found this one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Does what it claims
customer_reviews.text: This product does exactly what it claims. It is a great product for babies with colic.
customer_reviews.author: PAB

customer_reviews.title: Good quality
customer_reviews.text: Loves these bottles and quality. The only negative thing about these bottles is there is many pieces and to clean is a hassle but other than that live them!
customer_reviews.author: Rafael

customer_reviews.title: Bottle design is better
customer_reviews.text: This design is better, because my baby likes to drink milk lying down, but every time she drinks milk, she leaks milk, so I don't like it
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Best bottles ever
customer_reviews.text: These bottles are amazing! My son was tounge tied and these were the only bottles he could drink from without spilling it everywhere. I've been using this brand and type of bottle for 8 months, and I have nothing bad to say about them.
customer_reviews.author: Stiles

product_meta.title: Playtex Baby VentAire Bottle, Helps Prevent Colic and Reflux, 9 Ounce Bottles, 3 Count
product_meta.description:
Playtex Baby VentAire Bottles provide complete tummy comfort for easy switching between breast and bottle feeding. VentAire Bottles are designed with doctor-recommended features that help prevent colic and reflux. The patented bottom vent promotes an air-free feed, and the ergonomic, angled design promotes semi-upright feeding to help prevent ear infections. Unlike nipple vented bottles, VentAire's bottom vent keeps air at the back of the bottle and prevents it from mixing with milk as your baby drinks. Less air bubbles in your baby's milk means reduced colic, reflux, gas, burping and fussiness. Playtex Baby offers a variety of uniquely designed bottles that meet all of your baby’s changing feeding needs. All Playtex Baby products are BPA, PVC and Phthalate Free.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
The Playtex VentAire wide bottle has an angled shape to encourage semi-upright feeding. It helps prevent gas and spit ups with a special leak-proof bottom vent that eliminates bubbles. This 6-oz. baby bottle comes with a silicone nipple with a natural shape to avoid nipple confusion. Its wide neck allows easy refilling. This BPA-free baby bottle is shatterproof and dishwasher safe for easy maintenance. It comes with a cap for convenience when traveling. Available packs of 3. The set includes three 4-oz. bottles The angled shape of the bottle feeds your baby with virtually no bubbles, which means less gas Bottles have an opening at the end for easy, complete cleaning The set includes natural-shape, fast-flow nipples
feature_bullets: ANTI-COLIC DESIGN - VentAire bottles are specially designed to prevent colic by reducing air ingestion. The patented anti-colic bottom vent keeps air at the back of the bottle as baby drinks so no air mixes with the milk.
ANGLED DESIGN - The bottle's ergonomic, angled design promotes semi-upright feeding which is recommended by pediatricians to help prevent ear infections.
DOCTOR RECOMMENDED FEATURES - The bottom vent for air-free feeding and the angled design for more upright feeding are doctor recommended to help reduce reflux, colic, gas, burping and spit up.

NIPPLE DESIGNED TO FEEL LIKE MOM - Designed to be most like mom, the wide shape Naturalatch silicone nipple encourages proper latching, promotes healthy feeding and allows you to easily switch between breast and bottle feeding.
EASY TO CLEAN & REASSEMBLE - Ventaire bottles are designed with fewer parts, making cleaning and reassembly quick and easy.

specifications.Care instructions: All parts disassembled and cleaned with hot soapy water or on top rack of dishwasher. Make sure all parts are completely dried before next use.
specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,163 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
